data.name: سُورَةُ الذَّارِيَاتِ
data.englishBism: In the name of God, The Most Gracious, The Dispenser of Grace

ayahs.englishText: CONSIDER the winds that scatter the dust far and wide,
ayahs.arabicText: وَالذَّارِيَاتِ ذَرْوًا

ayahs.englishText: and those that carry the burden [of heavy clouds],
ayahs.arabicText: فَالْحَامِلَاتِ وِقْرًا

ayahs.englishText: and those that speed along with gentle ease,
ayahs.arabicText: فَالْجَارِيَاتِ يُسْرًا

ayahs.englishText: and those that apportion [the gift of life] at [God’s] behest!
ayahs.arabicText: فَالْمُقَسِّمَاتِ أَمْرًا

ayahs.englishText: Verily, that which you are promised is true indeed,
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٌ

ayahs.englishText: and, verily, judgment is bound to come!
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّ الدِّينَ لَوَاقِعٌ

ayahs.englishText: CONSIDER the firmament full of starry paths!
ayahs.arabicText: وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْحُبُكِ

ayahs.englishText: Verily, [O men,] you are deeply at variance as to what to believe:
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّكُمْ لَفِي قَوْلٍ مُخْتَلِفٍ

ayahs.englishText: perverted in his views thereon is he who would deceive himself!
ayahs.arabicText: يُؤْفَكُ عَنْهُ مَنْ أُفِكَ

ayahs.englishText: They but destroy themselves, they who are given to guessing at what they cannot ascertain –
ayahs.arabicText: قُتِلَ الْخَرَّاصُونَ

ayahs.englishText: they who blunder along, in ignorance lost –
ayahs.arabicText: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي غَمْرَةٍ سَاهُونَ

ayahs.englishText: they who [mockingly] ask, “When is that Day of Judgment to be?”
ayahs.arabicText: يَسْأَلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ الدِّينِ

ayahs.englishText: [It will be] a Day when they will be sorely tried by the fire,
ayahs.arabicText: يَوْمَ هُمْ عَلَى النَّارِ يُفْتَنُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [and will be told:] “Taste this your trial! It is this that you were so hastily asking for!”
ayahs.arabicText: ذُوقُوا فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [But,] behold, the God-conscious will find themselves amid gardens and springs,
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ

ayahs.englishText: enjoying all that their Sustainer will have granted them [because], verily, they were doers of good in the past:
ayahs.arabicText: آخِذِينَ مَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: they would lie asleep during but a small part of the night,
ayahs.arabicText: كَانُوا قَلِيلًا مِنَ اللَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and would pray for forgiveness from their innermost hearts;
ayahs.arabicText: وَبِالْأَسْحَارِ هُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and [would assign] in all that they possessed a due share unto such as might ask [for help] and such as might suffer priva­tion.
ayahs.arabicText: وَفِي أَمْوَالِهِمْ حَقٌّ لِلسَّائِلِ وَالْمَحْرُومِ

ayahs.englishText: AND ON EARTH there are signs [of God’s exis­tence, visible] to all who are endowed with inner certainty,
ayahs.arabicText: وَفِي الْأَرْضِ آيَاتٌ لِلْمُوقِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: just as [there are signs thereof] within your own selves: can you not, then, see?
ayahs.arabicText: وَفِي أَنْفُسِكُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And in heaven is [the source of] your sus­tenance [on earth] and [of] all that you are promised [for your life after death]:
ayahs.arabicText: وَفِي السَّمَاءِ رِزْقُكُمْ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ

ayahs.englishText: for, by the Sustainer of heaven and earth, this [life after death] is the very truth - as true as that you are endowed with speech!
ayahs.arabicText: فَوَرَبِّ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُ لَحَقٌّ مِثْلَ مَا أَنَّكُمْ تَنْطِقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: AND HAS the story of Abraham’s honoured guests ever come within thy ken?
ayahs.arabicText: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْمُكْرَمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: When those [heavenly messengers] came unto him and bade him peace, he answered, “[And upon you be] peace!” - [saying to himself,] “They are strangers.”
ayahs.arabicText: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا ۖ قَالَ سَلَامٌ قَوْمٌ مُنْكَرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Then he turned quietly to his household, and brought forth a fat [roasted] calf,
ayahs.arabicText: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ فَجَاءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: and placed it before them, saying, “Will you not eat?”
ayahs.arabicText: فَقَرَّبَهُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [And when he saw that the guests would not eat,] he became apprehensive of them; [but] they said, “Fear not” - and gave him the glad tiding of [the birth of] a son who would be endowed with deep knowledge.
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ

ayahs.englishText: Thereupon his wife approached [the guests] with a loud cry, and struck her face [in astonishment] and exclaimed: “A barren old woman [like me]!”
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَقْبَلَتِ امْرَأَتُهُ فِي صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٌ

ayahs.englishText: They answered: “Thus has thy Sustainer decreed; and, verily, He alone is truly wise, all- knowing!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْحَكِيمُ الْعَلِيمُ

ayahs.englishText: Said [Abraham]: “And what [else] may you have in view, O you [heavenly] messengers?”
ayahs.arabicText: ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: They answered: “Behold, we have been sent unto a people lost in sin,
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُجْرِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: to let loose upon them stone-hard blows of chastisement,
ayahs.arabicText: لِنُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِنْ طِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: marked out in thy Sustainer’s sight for [the punishment of] such as have wasted their own selves.”
ayahs.arabicText: مُسَوَّمَةً عِنْدَ رَبِّكَ لِلْمُسْرِفِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And in the course of time We brought out [of Lot ’s city] such [few] believers as were there:
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَخْرَجْنَا مَنْ كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: for apart from one [single] house We did not find there any who had surrendered themselves to Us.
ayahs.arabicText: فَمَا وَجَدْنَا فِيهَا غَيْرَ بَيْتٍ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And so We left therein a message for those who fear the grievous suffering [which awaits all evildoers].
ayahs.arabicText: وَتَرَكْنَا فِيهَا آيَةً لِلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ

ayahs.englishText: AND IN [the story of Pharaoh and] Moses, too, [We left the same message: for] when We sent him unto Pharaoh with [Our] manifest authority,
ayahs.arabicText: وَفِي مُوسَىٰ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: and he turned away in [the pride of] his power and said, “A sorcerer [is this Moses], or a madman!” –
ayahs.arabicText: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكْنِهِ وَقَالَ سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ

ayahs.englishText: We seized him and his hosts, and cast them all into the sea: and [none but Pharaoh] himself was to blame [for what happened].
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَخَذْنَاهُ وَجُنُودَهُ فَنَبَذْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ

ayahs.englishText: And [you have the same message] in [what happened to the tribe of] Ad, when We let loose against them that life-destroying wind
ayahs.arabicText: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الرِّيحَ الْعَقِيمَ

ayahs.englishText: which spared nothing of what it came upon, but caused [all of] it to become like bones dead and decayed.
ayahs.arabicText: مَا تَذَرُ مِنْ شَيْءٍ أَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَالرَّمِيمِ

ayahs.englishText: And in [the story of the tribe of] Thamud, too, when they were told, “You shall enjoy your life for [but] a little while,”
ayahs.arabicText: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَمَتَّعُوا حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: after they had turned with disdain from their Sustainer’s commandment - whereupon the thunderbolt of punishment overtook them while they were [helplessly] looking on:
ayahs.arabicText: فَعَتَوْا عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّاعِقَةُ وَهُمْ يَنْظُرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: for they were unable even to rise, and could not defend themselves.
ayahs.arabicText: فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مِنْ قِيَامٍ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنْتَصِرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And [thus, too, We destroyed] Noah’s people aforetime: for they were iniquitous folk.
ayahs.arabicText: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ

ayahs.englishText: AND IT IS We who have built the universe with [Our creative] power; and, verily, it is We who are steadily expanding it.
ayahs.arabicText: وَالسَّمَاءَ بَنَيْنَاهَا بِأَيْدٍ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And the earth have We spread out wide - and how well have We ordered it!
ayahs.arabicText: وَالْأَرْضَ فَرَشْنَاهَا فَنِعْمَ الْمَاهِدُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And in everything have We created oppos­ites, so that you might bear in mind [that God alone is One].
ayahs.arabicText: وَمِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَا زَوْجَيْنِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And so, [O Muhammad, say unto them:] “Flee unto God [from all that is false and evil]! Verily, I am a plain warner to you from Him!
ayahs.arabicText: فَفِرُّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُمْ مِنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ

ayahs.englishText: And do not ascribe divinity to aught side by side with God: verily, I am a plain warner to you from Him!”
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَا تَجْعَلُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُمْ مِنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ

ayahs.englishText: [But] thus it is: never yet came any apostle to those who lived before their time but they said, “A spellbinder [Lit., "sorcerer".] [is he], or a madman!”
ayahs.arabicText: كَذَٰلِكَ مَا أَتَى الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ مِنْ رَسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُوا سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ

ayahs.englishText: Have they, perchance, handed down this [way of thinking] as a legacy unto one another? Nay, they are people filled with overweening ar­rogance!
ayahs.arabicText: أَتَوَاصَوْا بِهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Turn, then, away from them, and thou shalt incur no blame;
ayahs.arabicText: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَمَا أَنْتَ بِمَلُومٍ

ayahs.englishText: yet go on reminding [all who would listen]: for, verily, such a reminder will profit the believers.
ayahs.arabicText: وَذَكِّرْ فَإِنَّ الذِّكْرَىٰ تَنْفَعُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And [tell them that] I have not created the invisible beings and men to any end other than that they may [know and] worship Me.
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا خَلَقْتُ الْجِنَّ وَالْإِنْسَ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُونِ

ayahs.englishText: [But withal,] no sustenance do I ever demand of them, nor do I demand that they feed Me:
ayahs.arabicText: مَا أُرِيدُ مِنْهُمْ مِنْ رِزْقٍ وَمَا أُرِيدُ أَنْ يُطْعِمُونِ

ayahs.englishText: for, verily, God Himself is the Provider of all sustenance, the Lord of all might, the Eternal!
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الرَّزَّاقُ ذُو الْقُوَّةِ الْمَتِينُ

ayahs.englishText: And, verily, they who are bent on doing evil shall have their share [of evil] like unto the share of their fellows [of old]: so let them not ask Me to hasten [their doom]!
ayahs.arabicText: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ذَنُوبًا مِثْلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصْحَابِهِمْ فَلَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونِ

ayahs.englishText: For, woe unto those who are bent on denying the truth - [woe] on the Day which they have been promised
ayahs.arabicText: فَوَيْلٌ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ يَوْمِهِمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
